document.title: A Reflection on Habitual Belief and Habitual Doubt
document.abstract: Some people are habitual "believers" while others are habitual "doubters." I' m a believer, but doubting others helps me believe myself I explore the idea that examining our individual habitual relationships with believing and doubting helps us think better and relate better to others and to ourselves.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Irene Papoulis is Principal Lecturer in the Allan K. Smith Center for Writing and Rhetoric at Trinity College, Hartford, CT. She also currently serves as co-chair, with Stan Scott, of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning.
